newsitem.title: JORDAN: Arafat in Jordan for talks with King Hussein.
newsitem.headline: Arafat in Jordan for talks with King Hussein.

text.p: Palestinian leader Yasser Arafat crossed into Jordan on Monday from the West Bank to brief King Hussein on the latest impasse in Israeli-Palestinian talks since a recent flare-up in violence.
Arafat was due to meet the king in the Raghdan Palace in Amman, Jordanian officials said.
Israel and the Palestinians have fallen out over Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's delay in implementing a redeployment in the West Bank town of Hebron.
"We are here to meet King Hussein to discuss our concerns about the lack of implementing the accords, which we all signed," Arafat told reporters at the Allenby Bridge.

PLO officials said Arafat had rejected a proposal by Netanyahu that they could hold a summit on Monday if Arafat agreed to change the Hebron deal signed a year ago by Israel's previous government and give Israel powers in areas that were to be given to the PLO.
